title: Authors and Citation
text: quantixed. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Royle S (2022). TrackMateR: Working TrackMate outputs R. R package version 0.1.0, https://quantixed.github.io/TrackMateR/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {TrackMateR: Working with TrackMate outputs in R},   author = {Stephen Royle},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://quantixed.github.io/TrackMateR/}, }

what: Working with TrackMate outputs in R
title: Working with TrackMate outputs in R
text: Analysis TrackMate XML outputs R TrackMate single-particle tracking plugin ImageJ/Fiji [1][2]. standard output tracking session TrackMate XML format. goal R package import data associated final filtered tracks TrackMate analysis visualization R. package builds initial work Julien Godet trackR. package development considered stable first release.

title: Working with TrackMate outputs in R
text: [1] Tinevez, J.-Y. et al. (2017) TrackMate: open extensible platform single-particle tracking. Methods, 115, 80–90. doi:10.1016/j.ymeth.2016.09.016 [2] Ershov, D., et al. (2021) Bringing TrackMate era machine-learning deep-learning. bioRxiv. doi:10.1101/2021.09.03.458852

what: Calculate alpha (relationship between MSD and normal diffusion) — calculateAlpha
title: Calculate alpha (relationship between MSD and normal diffusion) — calculateAlpha
text: Normal diffusion alpha = 1. Subdiffusion alpha < 1 superdiffusion alpha > 1. Input data matrix msd curves. Output mean log2(alpha), one value trace.

title: Calculate alpha (relationship between MSD and normal diffusion) — calculateAlpha
code: calculateAlpha(alphaMat, tstep)

title: Calculate alpha (relationship between MSD and normal diffusion) — calculateAlpha
text: alphaMat matrix msd curves, col track, row time lag (contain NAs) tstep variable. Time step seconds

title: Calculate alpha (relationship between MSD and normal diffusion) — calculateAlpha
text: numeric vector

title: Calculate Jump Distance (JD) — calculateJD
text: Calculation JD multiple tracks. Calculation equivalent single time lag point ensemble MSD curve, typically represented histogram Input data frame tracks imported using readTrackMateXML() default time step one frame - equivalent plot generated show displacement versus time.

title: Calculate Jump Distance (JD) — calculateJD
code: calculateJD(dataList, deltaT = 1)

title: Calculate Jump Distance (JD) — calculateJD
text: dataList list data frame (must include minimum - trace (track ID), x, y t (real coords)) calibration deltaT integer represent multiple frames analysed

title: Calculate Jump Distance (JD) — calculateJD
text: list data frame jump distances, NAs removed; numeric variable (jumptime)

title: Calculate Jump Distance (JD) — calculateJD
code: xmlPath <- "~/Desktop/FakeTracks.xml" tmObj <- readTrackMateXML(XMLpath = xmlPath) #> Error: XML content does not seem to be XML: '' tmObj <- correctTrackMateData(tmObj, xyscalar = 0.04) #> Error in correctTrackMateData(tmObj, xyscalar = 0.04): object 'tmObj' not found jdObj <- calculateJD(dataList = tmObj, deltaT = 2) #> Error in calculateJD(dataList = tmObj, deltaT = 2): object 'tmObj' not found

title: Calculate Mean Squared Displacement (MSD) — calculateMSD
text: Calculation MSD multiple tracks. two methods everaging MSD data multiple tracks: ensemble = time lag average squared displacements tracks time-averaged = find MSD track generate average MSD curves MSD curves identical tracks length, diverge . Standard deviation large ensemble smaller time-averaged data. Input data frame tracks imported using readTrackMateXML()

title: Calculate Mean Squared Displacement (MSD) — calculateMSD
code: calculateMSD(df, method = "timeaveraged", N = 4, short = 0)

title: Calculate Mean Squared Displacement (MSD) — calculateMSD
text: df data frame must include minimum - trace (track ID), x, y t (real coords) method string. Either "ensemble" "timeaveraged" (default) N numeric variable MSD. dt 1/N number data points (4 recommended) short numeric variable shortest number points analyse. Note, uses number frames start, number points track, .e. track <short points many gaps remain

title: Calculate Mean Squared Displacement (MSD) — calculateMSD
text: list data frame vector

title: Calculate Mean Squared Displacement (MSD) — calculateMSD
code: xmlPath <- "~/Desktop/FakeTracks.xml" tmObj <- readTrackMateXML(XMLpath = xmlPath) #> Error: XML content does not seem to be XML: '' tmObj <- correctTrackMateData(tmObj, xyscalar = 0.04) #> Error in correctTrackMateData(tmObj, xyscalar = 0.04): object 'tmObj' not found tmDF <-  tmObj[[1]] #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'tmObj' not found msdObj <- calculateMSD(df = tmDF, method = "ensemble", N = 3, short = 8) #> Error in unique(df$trace): object 'tmDF' not found

title: Calculate density of tracks — calculateTrackDensity
text: Calculate track, using starting frame, relative density tracks. use search radius find many tracks starting frame neighbours track. number neighbours normalised search circle, track corner image 2 neighbours density 8. Code calculating search area (intersection search circle image border) taken https://petrelharp.github.io/circle_rectangle_intersection/circle_rectangle_intersection.html

title: Calculate density of tracks — calculateTrackDensity
code: calculateTrackDensity(dataList, radius = 1)

title: Calculate density of tracks — calculateTrackDensity
text: dataList list data frame (must include minimum - trace (track ID), x, y frame (real coords)) calibration data frame radius numeric variable search radius (spatial units data)

title: Calculate density of tracks — calculateTrackDensity
text: data frame

title: Calculate density of tracks — calculateTrackDensity
code: xmlPath <- "~/Desktop/FakeTracks.xml" tmObj <- readTrackMateXML(XMLpath = xmlPath) #> Error: XML content does not seem to be XML: '' tmObj <- correctTrackMateData(dataList = tmObj, xyscalar = 0.04) #> Error in correctTrackMateData(dataList = tmObj, xyscalar = 0.04): object 'tmObj' not found tdDF <- calculateTrackDensity(dataList = tmObj, radius = 2) #> Error in calculateTrackDensity(dataList = tmObj, radius = 2): object 'tmObj' not found

what: Correct distance and time of imported TrackMate data. — correctTrackMateData
title: Correct distance and time of imported TrackMate data. — correctTrackMateData
text: TrackMate data pixels /frames, data frame can converted function.

title: Correct distance and time of imported TrackMate data. — correctTrackMateData
code: correctTrackMateData(   dataList,   xyscalar = 1,   tscalar = 1,   xyunit = NULL,   tunit = NULL )

title: Correct distance and time of imported TrackMate data. — correctTrackMateData
text: dataList list data frame (track data) calibration data frame (TrackMate XML) xyscalar numeric multiplier correct pixel size original movie. Assumes isotropic scaling, .e. pixel height = pixel width tscalar numeric multiplier correct frame interval original movie. Frame interval tracked data. xyunit string describe spatial units tunit string describe temporal unit

title: Correct distance and time of imported TrackMate data. — correctTrackMateData
text: list two data frames

title: Correct distance and time of imported TrackMate data. — correctTrackMateData
code: xmlPath <- "~/Desktop/FakeTracks.xml" tmObj <- readTrackMateXML(XMLpath = xmlPath) #> Error: XML content does not seem to be XML: '' # in the case where pixel size is 0.03 um and original data is 1 pixel, xyscalar = 0.03 tmObj <- correctTrackMateData(dataList = tmObj, xyscalar = 0.03) #> Error in correctTrackMateData(dataList = tmObj, xyscalar = 0.03): object 'tmObj' not found

Fitting jump distance (JD) data — fittingJD
text: Jump Distances calculated given time lag. can described fitting curves data, either using histogram cumulative probability density function. Firtting histogram sensitive binning parameters ECDF performs better general use. idea behind analysis given : - Weimann et al. (2013) quantitative comparison single-dye tracking analysis tools using Monte Carlo simulations. PloS One 8, e64287. - Menssen & Mani (2019) Jump-Distance-Based Parameter Inference Scheme Particulate Trajectories, Biophysical Journal, 117: 1, 143-156. bulk code taken trackR JuG

title: Fitting jump distance (JD) data — fittingJD
code: fittingJD(   df,   mode = "ECDF",   nPop = 1,   init,   units = c("um", "s"),   timeRes = 1,   breaks = 100 )

title: Fitting jump distance (JD) data — fittingJD
text: df data frame column named jump jump distances mode string indicated ECDF (default) hist (histogram) nPop number populations diffusing species (1, 2 3) init initialisation parameters nls fit example list(D2 = 200,  D1 = 0.1) list(D2 = 0.01,  D1=0.1, D3=10, D4=100) units character vector describe units (defaults um, micrometres  s, seconds) timeRes time resolution per unit jump. Frame interval 0.5 s jump interval two steps, timeRes = 1. breaks number bins histogram. ECDF breaks can high e.g. 100, mode = "hist" low, perhaps 30.

title: Fitting jump distance (JD) data — fittingJD
text: ggplot

title: Fitting jump distance (JD) data — fittingJD
code: xmlPath <- "~/Desktop/FakeTracks.xml" tmObj <- readTrackMateXML(XMLpath = xmlPath) #> Error: XML content does not seem to be XML: '' tmObj <- correctTrackMateData(tmObj, xyscalar = 0.04) #> Error in correctTrackMateData(tmObj, xyscalar = 0.04): object 'tmObj' not found jdObj <- calculateJD(dataList = tmObj, deltaT = 2) #> Error in calculateJD(dataList = tmObj, deltaT = 2): object 'tmObj' not found jdDF <- jdObj[[1]] #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'jdObj' not found fittingJD(df = jdDF, mode = "ECDF", nPop = 2, breaks = 100, timeRes = 0.06) #> Error in hist(df$jump, breaks = breaks, plot = FALSE): object 'jdDF' not found

title: Make Summary Report — makeSummaryReport
text: Generate several plots visualise TrackMate data generate report. use um ggsave currently save unicode PDF reliably. code switchable accommodate making "report" (one dataset) "summary" (several related datasets combined)

title: Make Summary Report — makeSummaryReport
code: makeSummaryReport(   tmList,   msdList,   jumpList,   tddf,   titleStr = "",   subStr = "",   auto = FALSE,   summary = FALSE )

title: Make Summary Report — makeSummaryReport
text: tmList list trackmate data calibration msdList MSD summary alpha list = output calculateMSD() jumpList list data frame jump data variable passed timeRes tddf data frame track density data titleStr string used title report subStr string used subtitle report auto boolean selects returning patchwork report list patchwork report data frame summary summary boolean selects summary

title: Make Summary Report — makeSummaryReport
text: patchwork ggplot list patchwork ggplot data frame summary data

title: Make Summary Report — makeSummaryReport
code: xmlPath <- "~/Desktop/FakeTracks.xml" tmObj <- readTrackMateXML(XMLpath = xmlPath) #> Error: XML content does not seem to be XML: '' tmObj <- correctTrackMateData(tmObj, xyscalar = 0.04) #> Error in correctTrackMateData(tmObj, xyscalar = 0.04): object 'tmObj' not found tmDF <- tmObj[[1]] #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'tmObj' not found calibrationDF <- tmObj[[2]] #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'tmObj' not found msdObj <- calculateMSD(df = tmDF, method = "ensemble", N = 3, short = 8) #> Error in unique(df$trace): object 'tmDF' not found jdObj <- calculateJD(dataList = tmObj, deltaT = 1) #> Error in calculateJD(dataList = tmObj, deltaT = 1): object 'tmObj' not found tdDF <- calculateTrackDensity(dataList = tmObj, radius = 1.5) #> Error in calculateTrackDensity(dataList = tmObj, radius = 1.5): object 'tmObj' not found fileName <- tools::file_path_sans_ext(basename(xmlPath)) reportObj <- makeSummaryReport(tmList = tmObj, msdList = msdObj, jumpList = jdObj, tddf = tdDF, titleStr = "Report", subStr = fileName, auto = TRUE) #> Error in makeSummaryReport(tmList = tmObj, msdList = msdObj, jumpList = jdObj,     tddf = tdDF, titleStr = "Report", subStr = fileName, auto = TRUE): object 'tmObj' not found

what: Make a plot of MSD data — plotMSD
title: Make a plot of MSD data — plotMSD
text: Generate plot MSD series increasing time lags. Input output CalculateMSD(), plot display ensemble time-averaged MSD (whatever requested) fit first four points displayed evaluate alpha. Diffusion coefficient fit displayed top-left.

title: Make a plot of MSD data — plotMSD
code: plotMSD(   df,   units = c("um", "s"),   bars = FALSE,   xlog = FALSE,   ylog = FALSE,   auto = FALSE )

title: Make a plot of MSD data — plotMSD
text: df MSD summary = output calculateMSD() units character vector describe units (defaults um, micrometres  s, seconds) bars boolean request error bars (1 x SD) xlog boolean request log10 x axis ylog boolean request log10 y axis auto boolean request plot , TRUE gives plot D list

title: Make a plot of MSD data — plotMSD
text: ggplot ggplot variable

title: Make a plot of MSD data — plotMSD
code: xmlPath <- "~/Desktop/FakeTracks.xml" datalist <- readTrackMateXML(XMLpath = xmlPath) #> Error: XML content does not seem to be XML: '' data <-  datalist[[1]] #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'datalist' not found # use the ensemble method and only look at tracks with more than 8 points msdobj <- calculateMSD(df = data, method = "ensemble", N = 3, short = 8) #> Error in df$trace: object of type 'closure' is not subsettable msddf <- msdobj[[1]] #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'msdobj' not found plotMSD(msddf, bars = FALSE) #> Error in is.data.frame(data): object 'msddf' not found

what: Read TrackMate XML output files. — readTrackMateXML
title: Read TrackMate XML output files. — readTrackMateXML
text: Produces data frame spots filtered tracks, ordered track number. warning generated scaling pixels rather real units.

title: Read TrackMate XML output files. — readTrackMateXML
code: readTrackMateXML(XMLpath)

title: Read TrackMate XML output files. — readTrackMateXML
text: XMLpath path xml file

title: Read TrackMate XML output files. — readTrackMateXML
text: list two data frames

title: Read TrackMate XML output files. — readTrackMateXML
code: xmlPath <- "~/Desktop/FakeTracks.xml" tmObj <- readTrackMateXML(XMLpath = xmlPath) #> Error: XML content does not seem to be XML: '' # get the track data in a data frame tmDF <-  tmObj[[1]] #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'tmObj' not found # get the calibration data in a data frame calibrationDF <- tmObj[[2]] #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'tmObj' not found
